## Builder

Problem builder definitions [asd](api.qmd#doc-OCProblemBuilder)

:::{.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
### OCProblemBuilder {#doc-OCProblemBuilder .unnumbered}
```julia
struct OCProblemBuilder{S, C, G} <: Corleone.AbstractBuilder
```

Takes in a `System` with defined `cost` and optional `constraints` and `consolidate` together with a [`ShootingGrid`](@ref) and [`AbstractControlFormulation`](@ref)s and build the related `OptimizationProblem`.

 [Source](https://kosinus.math.uni-magdeburg.de/mathopt/software/corleone/-/blob/main/src/builders/ocbuilder.jl?ref_type=heads#1) 

:::
:::{.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
### OEDProblemBuilder {#doc-OEDProblemBuilder .unnumbered}
```julia
struct OEDProblemBuilder{C, G} <: Corleone.AbstractBuilder
```

Takes in a `System` with defined `cost` and optional `constraints` and `consolidate` together with a [`ShootingGrid`](@ref) and [`AbstractControlFormulation`](@ref)s and build the related `OptimizationProblem`.

 [Source](https://kosinus.math.uni-magdeburg.de/mathopt/software/corleone/-/blob/main/src/builders/oedbuilder.jl?ref_type=heads#1) 

:::


## Control Signals

Control signal definitions

:::{.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
### DirectControlCallback {#doc-DirectControlCallback .unnumbered}
```julia
struct DirectControlCallback{D} <: Corleone.AbstractControlFormulation
```

Extends the system using a `DiscreteCallback` at the specified timepoints for each control signal.

**Fields**

  * `controls`: The control specifications

**Formulations**

If the control signal `u` is a variable, the corresponding callback will be added directly

$$
u = u_i
$$

If the control signal acts on a differential variable, we use a dummy parameter `uₚ`

$$
u_t = u_p,
u_p = u_i
$$

 [Source](https://kosinus.math.uni-magdeburg.de/mathopt/software/corleone/-/blob/main/src/control_formulations/directcallback.jl?ref_type=heads#1) 

:::
:::{.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
### IfElseControl {#doc-IfElseControl .unnumbered}
```julia
struct IfElseControl{D} <: Corleone.AbstractControlFormulation
```

Extends the system using a `ifelse` based approach to find the active local control at the specified timepoints for each control signal.

**Fields**

  * `controls`: The control specifications

**Formulations**

If the control signal `u` is a variable, the equation will be added directly

```julia
u ~ sum(ifelse((t >= uₜ[i]) && (uₜ[i+1] > t), uᵢ[i], 0) for i in eachindex(uᵢ))
```

where `u_i` are the local controls and `u_t` the timepoints.

 [Source](https://kosinus.math.uni-magdeburg.de/mathopt/software/corleone/-/blob/main/src/control_formulations/ifelsecontrol.jl?ref_type=heads#1) 

:::
